intro: Lomelosia deserticola, commonly known as the desert lomelosia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve moisture. Lomelosia deserticola produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
